value.title: DAX Fridays! #23: ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: In this video we will through the ISFILTERED function in DAX.  This function is useful to detect when a column has been filtered and as shown in this video you can use it to set conditions when a column has been filtered. value.title: DAX Fridays! #29: HASONEVALUE
value.excerpt: Have you ever got this error message?: A table of multiple values was supplied where a single value was expected ?  If you have, make sure to check out this video to understand how to solve it.  HASONEVALUE is a DAX function that will check if the table returned has one value or not. If it has, it will

value.title: DAX Fridays! #30: SEARCH vs FIND
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays! tutorial we are going to go though examples on how to use two DAX functions: SEARCH and FIND  SEARCH and FIND DAX functions are used to find the number of characters at which a specific word is found in a column. value.title: DAX Fridays! #35: VALUES
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays! video we will go through the DAX function VALUES. VALES will return a unique value when a table of multiple values is the result of your calculation. value.title: DAX Fridays! #40: DATESINPERIOD (Moving x Months average)
value.excerpt: In today's video we will learn how to use DATESINPERIOD function using Moving Average calculation.  First we will explain what a Moving average 3 months is and how it is calculated. value.title: DAX Fridays! #44: CROSSFILTER
value.excerpt: IN todays video, we will go trough an example on how crossfilter works. Crossfilter can simulate relationships and active and deactivate them as you need to. value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.

value.title: Create a subset of the table in Power BI and add calculations using SELECTCOLUMNS DAX Function
value.excerpt: Previously I explained the AddColumns function as a function that adds one or more columns to the existing table, In this article and video, I'll explain another similar and useful function with slightly different behavior: SelectColumns, and you will learn how you can use it in Power BI and DAX. value.title: Find a Text Term in a Field in Power BI Using DAX Functions
value.excerpt: In Power BI, there are multiple ways of searching for a text term inside a text field, you can use Power Query for doing this operation or calculations in DAX.
